intro: Gagea stipitata var. ova, commonly known as the ovate gagea, is a flowering plant belonging to the Liliaceae family. It is characterized by its bulbous rhizomes and grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink. It thrives in woodland and open habitats, preferring well-drained soils. This variety is notable for its ornamental value and is often found in regions of western North America.
